output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of image processing techniques. You should now be able to perform basic image manipulation and analysis.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of image processing! This course will introduce you to the fundamental concepts and techniques used to manipulate and analyze digital images. No prior experience is necessary.

chapters.description: Definition of image processing, its applications, and the difference between analog and digital images.
Understanding pixels, image resolution, color depth, and basic image formats (JPEG, PNG, GIF).
Brief overview of how digital images are captured using cameras and scanners.
Introduction to spatial domain techniques like contrast stretching and histogram equalization.
Learn how to modify the brightness and contrast of an image using simple operations.
Overview of color balance and simple color adjustments.
Introduction to image filtering and its purpose.
Understanding and applying mean and median filters for noise reduction.
Introduction to edge detection and sharpening using basic filters.
Introduction to image segmentation and its importance.
Simple thresholding methods for separating objects from the background.
Brief introduction to using edges for image segmentation.
Introduction to image compression and its need.
Understanding the difference between lossy and lossless compression techniques.
Overview of JPEG and PNG compression methods.
